item.name: /events
item.description:
The operation returns an array of events, allowing to easily retrieve all the created events.
This is useful for example in the frontend's event page, where events are displayed.

response.name: events/GetAllEvents/should return all events
response.body: [{"title":"Great event","description":"This was a nice and iconic event","teamMembers":[{"name":"Test Account","email":"test_account@test.com","bio":"This is a test account","birthDate":"28-07-2001","photoPath":"https://test-photo.com","linkedin":"https://linkedin.com","github":"https://github.com","websites":[{"url":"https://test-website.com","iconPath":"https://test-website.com/logo.png","id":1}],"roles":[],"id":1}],"registerUrl":"https://docs.google.com/forms","dateInterval":{"startDate":"28-07-2022","endDate":"30-07-2022"},"location":"FEUP","category":"Great Events","thumbnailPath":"https://example.com/exampleThumbnail","associatedRoles":[],"id":1},{"title":"Bad event","description":"This event was a failure","teamMembers":[],"dateInterval":{"startDate":"27-10-2021"},"thumbnailPath":"https://example.com/exampleThumbnail2","associatedRoles":[],"id":2}]

It might be used to generate the specific event page.

item.name: /projects
item.description:
The operation returns an array of projects, allowing to easily retrieve all the created projects.
This is useful for example in the frontend project page, where projects are displayed.

item.name: /projects/{id}/archive
item.description:
This endpoint updates projects as archived. This is useful to mark no longer
maintained or complete projects of the Nucleus.

variable.description: ID of the project to archive

response.name: projects/ArchiveProject/should archive the project

variable.description: ID of the project to archive
